page.title: 06Southam's Customs
page.content: The oldest traditional event in Southam is the Mop Fair held in October of each year. Servants used to be hired at the Mop, but now it is just a fair spreading right through the centre of the town, attracting people from the villages nearby with its colour and noise. The fair is combined with an Ox Roast, again an ancient custom, recently revived. Each year, on Spring Bank Holiday Monday, there is a carnival. Local organisations decorate lorries and people wear fancy dress and parade through the streets. During the summer there are many fetes whose aim is to raise money for local charities. There are things to buy, games to play, sights to watch and things to eat. It is a pleasant way to spend a sunny afternoon, but not in 1985 which has been very wet.
